creator: bernard.durfee@suny.edu
text:
When failing either authentication or access control, Tomcat only logs a debug 
message. It would be very valuable to log these failures as warnings. This 
would enable system administrators to watch for patterns, such as password 
crack attempts or repeated attempts to access unauthorized resources.

In addition to upgrading the log entry to a warning, all appropriate data about 
the failure should be logged, such as the IP, user, resource, etc.

I believe this change could be made in the AuthenticatorBase class, which would 
enhance all subclasses.

Please submit the patch for what you want, including the fields you want logged,
the exact log message, etc.
creator: yoavs@computer.org

text:
No patch provided and no interest from other users.

I would add that all of this information is available in the access log and can be used by tools like fail2ban. Users considering this should also look at the LockOutRealm.
